mozilla.components.concept.toolbar

Interface Toolbar


  • public Toolbar

    Interface to be implemented by components that provide browser toolbar functionality.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void displayProgress(int progress)
      Displays the given loading progress. Expects values in the range 0,100.
      void displayUrl(java.lang.String url)
      Displays the given URL string as part of this Toolbar.
      boolean onBackPressed()
      Should be called by an activity when the user pressed the back key of the device.
      void setOnUrlChangeListener(kotlin.jvm.functions.Function1<? super java.lang.String,kotlin.Unit> listener)
      Registers the given function to be invoked when the url changes as result of user input.

    • Method Detail

      • displayUrl

        void displayUrl(java.lang.String url)

        Displays the given URL string as part of this Toolbar.

        Parameters:
        url - the url to display

      • displayProgress

        void displayProgress(int progress)

        Displays the given loading progress. Expects values in the range 0,100.

        See Also:
        0,100

      • onBackPressed

        boolean onBackPressed()

        Should be called by an activity when the user pressed the back key of the device.

        Returns:
        Returns true if the back press event was handled and should not be propagated further.

      • setOnUrlChangeListener

        void setOnUrlChangeListener(kotlin.jvm.functions.Function1<? super java.lang.String,kotlin.Unit> listener)

        Registers the given function to be invoked when the url changes as result of user input.

        Parameters:
        listener - the listener function
